class.name: System.Diagnostics.DefaultTraceListener
class.summary: Provides the default output methods and behavior for tracing.
class.remarks:
Since there is no debugging API ala Win32 on Mono, Console.Out is being used as the default output method.
This needs help, as MSDN specifies that GUI widgets be used for certain features. The short-term solution is to just send output to OutputDebugString.

property.name: LogFileName
property.summary: Gets or sets name of a log file to write trace or debug messages to.
property.value: The name of a log file to write trace or debug messages to.

method.name: WriteLine(System.String)
method.summary: Writes the output to the Console, followed by a newline

method.name: Write(System.String)
method.summary: Writes the output to the Console.

method.name: Fail(System.String, System.String)
method.summary: Emits or displays detailed messages and a stack trace for an assertion that always fails.
method.param: The message to emit or display.
The detailed message to emit or display.

method.name: Fail(System.String)
method.summary: Emits or displays a message and a stack trace for an assertion that always fails.
method.param: The message to emit or display.
